overview_of_class: Behavioral economics incorporates results from psychology in the attempt to gain deeper insight into economic behavior, to make better predictions, and to generate improved policy prescriptions.  A core belief of behavioral economists is that, since psychology studies human judgment and behavior, our understanding can be improved by utilizing more realistic psychological underpinnings of economic analysis. This course surveys these attempts to improve the field of economics.
name: Behavioral Economics
subject: ECON
